se.softhouse.common.testlib
Class Locales

java.lang.Object
  se.softhouse.common.testlib.Locales

@ThreadSafe
public final class Locales
extends Object

 Utilities for testing different Locales.

Method Detail

setDefault

public static void setDefault(Locale locale)
                       throws InterruptedException
  Makes it possible to test invalid usages of Locale.getDefault() in a synchronized
  manner making sure that test cases don't fail suddenly when they are run concurrently.
  I.e a pipelined version of Locale.getDefault().
 
 You're allowed to use Locale.getDefault() for 60 seconds then other threads
 will start to receive InterruptedException because they can't get access to it.
 If you need more than 60 seconds use setDefault(Locale, long, TimeUnit) instead.
 Note: Don't forget to call resetDefaultLocale() when you're done with using
 the Locale.getDefault() method.





Parameters:
locale - the locale Locale.getDefault() should return

Throws:

InterruptedException - if it wasn't possible to invoke
             Locale.setDefault(Locale) due to another thread using the default
             locale for longer than he specified (default 60 seconds)

setDefault

public static void setDefault(Locale locale,
                              long time,
                              TimeUnit unit)
                       throws InterruptedException
 Works like setDefault(Locale) but it allows you to use Locale.getDefault()
 for the time specified by time and unit.
 Note: if the current thread already "owns" the default locale (by having called
 setDefault(Locale, long, TimeUnit) before) time and unit will be
 ignored.





Parameters:
locale - the locale Locale.getDefault() should return
time - the maximum time to use Locale.getDefault()
unit - the TimeUnit of the time argument

Throws:

InterruptedException - if it wasn't possible to invoke
             Locale.setDefault(Locale) due to another thread using the default
             locale for longer than he specified (default 60 seconds)

resetDefaultLocale

public static Locale resetDefaultLocale()
Resets Locale.getDefault() to what it was when setDefault(Locale) was called. Should be called after you're done with using Locale.getDefault(), typically called in a "tear down" method.

Returns:
the default Locale that was set, or null if it wasn't this thread that owned the default locale
